Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
A bill to require the Securities and Exchange Commission to refund or credit certain excess payments made to the Commission.
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs.

calendar.text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Ordered to be reported without amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs. Reported by Senator Crapo without amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 13.

vote.text: Passed Senate without amendment by Unanimous Consent.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

committee.name: Senate Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The expanded summary of the Senate reported version is repeated here.)
Securities and Exchange Commission Overpayment Credit Act
(Sec. 2) This bill requires the Securities and Exchange Commission (SEC) to offset future fees and assessments due from a national securities exchange or association that: (1) has previously overpaid such fees and assessments, and (2) informs the SEC of the overpayment within 10 years.
